intro: Lepidium ruderale var. myrianthum, commonly known as the clustered peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. The species is adapted to dry, disturbed habitats and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
